Posts.Content: nikkidonahue wrote: I have been reading here for a few weeks but finally registered just now.  I saw others are also having surgery on December 1.  My story in short: I am 37, diagnosed 6/17/09, 2 months after having my 5th child.  Doc said I had a clogged milk duct from breastfeeding, turned out to be a giant, fast-growing lump of cancer!  Well I was sure shocked.  There hadn't been anything there 9 mos. before at my 1st prenatal appointment.  Anyway, I started chemo a week after diagnosis, which I finished 11/5.  Am getting ready for bilateral mastectomy with lymph nodes being removed on the cancer side as well.  I'm sure you can understand I have so much to do to prepare and it's not getting done!  With 5 children and homeschooling and my husband working 12-hour days right now, it's a little hectic.  But God is awesome and provides all our needs as well as peace and grace for each day.  Glad to "meet" you all and look forward to joining the community.  Nikki Diagnosed 6/17/09, 7x9cm tumor, 4 tx Cytoxan/Adriamycin, 12 tx Taxol, Bilateral Mast w/right lymph nodes removal 12/1/09, Post-surg pathology CLEAR - Praise God!, Rads 1/25/10-3/18/10, 28 reg/5 to scar. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First post - Surgery December 1 nikkidonahue nikkidonahue
